triples.name: Search and rescue
triples.relevance: The survey focuses on multi-robot systems supporting search and rescue operations in various environments.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: The paper discusses autonomous robots as primary agents in SAR operations.

triples.name: Teleoperation
triples.relevance: Teleoperated robots are discussed as an alternative to fully autonomous systems in SAR operations.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent perception and coordination are core topics discussed from a multi-agent systems perspective.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics provides coordination mechanisms for multi-robot SAR systems without centralized control.

triples.name: Robotic mapping
triples.relevance: Mapping is mentioned as a key capability that SAR robots provide to aid situational assessment.

triples.name: Simultaneous localization and mapping
triples.relevance: SLAM is a fundamental technique for multi-robot navigation and mapping in unknown environments.

triples.name: Active perception
triples.relevance: Active perception and active vision are explicitly highlighted as key topics in the survey's focus.

triples.name: Active vision
triples.relevance: Active vision is a core component of the survey title and focuses on robots optimizing their sensing.

triples.name: Surveillance
triples.relevance: Surveillance is mentioned as one of the key tasks multi-robot SAR systems can perform.

triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: Aerial robots/UAVs are one of the heterogeneous types of robots discussed in SAR contexts.

triples.name: Autonomous underwater vehicle
triples.relevance: Underwater robots are mentioned as one type of heterogeneous robot in different SAR environments.

triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: Ground robots are discussed as a major category of heterogeneous robots in multi-robot SAR systems.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning and path planning are essential for coordinating multi-robot SAR operations.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Computer vision is used in perception capabilities and processing sensor data in SAR robots.

triples.name: Sensor fusion
triples.relevance: Sensor fusion combines data from multiple robot sensors for improved situational awareness.

triples.name: Distributed control system
triples.relevance: Distributed control enables coordination and autonomy in multi-robot SAR systems without centralized command.

triples.name: Urban search and rescue
triples.relevance: Urban SAR is one specific environment context discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Lidar
triples.relevance: LiDAR is a key sensor technology used by SAR robots for mapping and perception.
